sessions.name: Children's Registration
sessions.location: Convention Center - Outside Room 151 G (First Floor)

sessions.name: Welcome Reception
sessions.description: Come join us for popcorn and lemonade while you visit with friends. Stay to enjoy the movie The Forge.

sessions.name: Movie: The Forge
sessions.description: This movie shows us the impact that engaging in mentorship can have on others.

sessions.name: Sign in for Children’s Program
sessions.location: Convention Center - Outside Room 151 G (First Floor)

sessions.name: Business Session
sessions.description:
• Call to Order
• Morning Devotion
• Report of the Registration Committee
• Reading and Approval of Minutes
• Report of the Amendments Committee
• Committee Reports

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Experience the SHINE (Serving Him in Nations Everywhere) Ministry!
sessions.description: In this inspiring and interactive workshop, discover how you can live a little bit of SHINE at home, bringing the heart of missions into your everyday life. Hear powerful testimonies from those who have served, explore the exciting history of SHINE, and be inspired by the impact seen in lives and communities around the world. With engaging stories, eye-opening statistics, and a fun, interactive atmosphere, this workshop will leave you energized and ready to be a light — wherever you are! Don’t miss this opportunity to connect, be challenged, and step into your role in God’s mission. Come and SHINE with us!

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Engaged Family
sessions.description: When we are faithful to the God-given responsibilities of family, our obedience will springboard us to fruitful ministries and blessings lasting for generations. Prepare to be greatly inspired and encouraged by simple concepts from scriptures regarding the importance of senior citizens, honoring our parents, and serving seniors within our communities
speakerNames: Jenny Stephens and Wayne Hrenyk - English (with translation equipment)

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Spiritual Warfare (Conflict)
sessions.description: We will explore how to find freedom in Christ Jesus; review the kingdom of God, the kingdom of Satan, and the struggles Christians face regularly (Ephesians 6:12); explore how to overcome negative thoughts, irrational feelings, and habitual sins; review God’s armor and how we may allow an opening for one of those missiles to penetrate us. We will also explore the warnings of habitual sins that can lead to a stronghold in our lives. And we will learn that repentance is the only way to free us, gaining God’s peace again. Lastly, we will explore dreams and biblical dream interpretation and visions.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Get A Grip On the Grind - A Little Organization Goes A Long Way In Achieving Success
sessions.description: Church ministry is much more than Sabbath worship services, potlucks, and Bible studies. It is also the ongoing challenge of finding people willing to serve, conducting business meetings, and creating committees. This workshop will present some practical methods and examples for getting a grip on the grind of recruiting and training ministry leaders, making meetings more productive, and retaining volunteers. A little organization can go a long way toward ministry success!

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Don’t Cross the Line
sessions.description: This workshop will teach you how to draw the line between your public and private communication. Learn the importance of how your social media posts affect your church and community. Understand the importance of internal and external agendas in live-streaming services and in live events, and become a more effective communicator to impact and engage your church and community.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Joyful Leap: Awakening the Church to Defend Life
sessions.description: Abortion is one of the greatest injustices of our time — and it’s closer to the church than we may realize. In this workshop, we’ll look honestly at what abortion is and how it impacts women, men, families, and even those sitting in our pews. We will dive into what God’s Word says about it. You’ll hear real statistics, biblical truth, and practical ways you and your church can stand for life and support both mothers and babies with compassion and conviction. My prayer is that you leave not just informed but deeply moved and ready to make a difference right where you are by caring for the least of these.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Engaging in the Community
sessions.description: Each member is gifted to fit within the body of believers and called to be a light in our communities. Hear how two groups of people engage in their communities in somewhat different ways. Have you thought of being a volunteer fireman or a volunteer sports coach in your community? Hear the motivation and impact of these choices, then join us and share your story in an open forum. Do you volunteer in a hospital, create quilts to support children impacted by tragedy, help in a school or non-profit, mentor students, serve in a senior residence, assist in a food bank, visit jails or prisons . . . ? The list of opportunities is long. Come share your story!
speakerNames: Tony Ling, Kurt and Kristi Lang, Carla McKibben - English (with translation equipment)

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Making Sabbath School Engaging
sessions.description: In this workshop, BA Editor Jason Overman will explore ways to make the most of the BAP Adult Sabbath school quarterlies. Whether you’re a Sabbath school teacher or student, this seminar gives fresh perspectives on an age-old and beloved tradition of our church: studying the Bible together.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Don’t Cross the Line
sessions.description: This workshop will teach you how to draw the line between your public and private communication. Learn the importance of how your social media posts affect your church and community. Understand the importance of internal and external agendas in live-streaming services and in live events, and become a more effective communicator to impact and engage your church and community.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Get A Grip On the Grind - A Little Organization Goes A Long Way In Achieving Success
sessions.description: Church ministry is much more than the Sabbath worship services, potlucks and Bible Studies. It is also the ongoing challenge of finding people willing to serve, business meetings, and committees. This workshop will present some practical methods and examples for getting a grip on the grind of recruiting and training ministry leaders, making meetings more productive, and retaining volunteers. A little organization can go a long way towards ministry success!

sessions.name: Evening Worship Service
sessions.description: “Grounded in Jesus” — Jesus, the Creator and King of the universe, wants to be the Lord of your heart. He invites us into a relationship so that we might be the recipients, yet also the conduits, of His power and presence. Are you grounded in Him?

sessions.name: Late-Night Options - Youth
sessions.location: Convention Center - Room 355 A/B/C (Third Floor) or Hall C (First Floor)

sessions.name: Business Session
sessions.description:
• Call to Order
• Morning Devotion
• Report of the Registration Committee
• Reading and Approval of Minutes
• Report of the Amendments Committee
• Committee Reports

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Unlock the Power of Great Church Sound! Part 1
sessions.description: Join us for an interactive, hands-on sound training session designed for those who run sound in church services. This is your chance to step behind the mixing board, listen, adjust, and learn in real-time! In this session, you will mix live sound and experience the impact of small adjustments; participate in A/B testing to hear the difference between good and bad mixes; get expert tips on common sound issues and how to fix them; and engage in a Q&A session to troubleshoot your toughest audio challenges. Whether you’re new to church sound or have years of experience, this session will equip you with practical skills to enhance worship through excellent audio. Come ready to listen, learn, and level up your sound mixing skills! Stick around for Part 2.
speakerNames: Ronald Rousseau and Robert Stephens - English/Spanish

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Balloon, Bubbles, Crafts, Food, Music, Recreation, Worship, Message. Now What? What Does it Take to be a Youth Camp Director?
sessions.description: This workshop is designed to help you understand what it takes to design, implement, and succeed in directing a successful God-centered youth camp. We will go through the steps of picking a theme; choosing staff, speakers, worship leaders, cooks; budgeting, cell phones, medical staff, insurance, programming, and marketing your camp before and after. Join two seasoned directors as we share our successes and failures in working with our next generation of church leadership.
speakerNames: Greg Haffner and Harold Ogren - English (with translation equipment)

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Introducing the International Federation
sessions.description: This workshop will delve into the transition of the International Ministerial Congress to the Church of God (Seventh Day) International Federation. You’ll have the chance to ask questions and receive updates on the organization that links us to a network of churches worldwide.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Put Me In, Coach: Experience the Fulfillment of Your Role on God’s Team
sessions.description: The goal of this workshop is to help members catch the vision to fulfill their places in the work of God’s vibrant twenty-first century Church of God (Seventh Day). We will consider the following: who God is calling to His team; the effects of serving and not serving on God’s team; finding your gifts and place on God’s team; a plan for equipping the players. Attendees should leave this workshop with a joyful and expectant heart regarding their roles in their local congregations, districts, and the General Conference.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Is Church Integration A Problem?
sessions.description: This workshop will go over the importance of church integration — not to enhance one’s culture, or structure, but to provide a model where everyone will be edified. Problems such as cultural identity, segregation, and lack of church identity will be discussed, and effective solutions will be provided. We will also touch on ways to connect with our church and community today.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Unlock the Power of Great Church Sound! Part 2
sessions.description: Join us for an interactive, hands-on sound training session designed for those who run sound in church services. This is your chance to step behind the mixing board, listen, adjust, and learn in real-time! In this session, you will mix live sound and experience the impact of small adjustments; participate in A/B testing to hear the difference between good and bad mixes; get expert tips on common sound issues and how to fix them; and engage in a Q&A session to troubleshoot your toughest audio challenges. Whether you’re new to church sound or have years of experience, this session will equip you with practical skills to enhance worship through excellent audio. Come ready to listen, learn, and level up your sound mixing skills! This is a continuation of Part 1.
speakerNames: Ronald Rousseau and Robert Stephens - English/Bilingual

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Strengthening Biblical Foundations Through Preteen Youth Camps
sessions.description: Did you know that most believers come to the Lord before age 13? Preteen youth ministry is an often under-appreciated but crucial work in the body of Christ. The call to follow Christ begins with planting, watering, and tending gospel seeds in the hearts of our young people, long before we see the harvest. Preteen youth camps are an amazing opportunity to engage in this work! In this workshop, a vision is cast for how preteen youth camp ministry can come alongside parents, Sabbath school teachers, pastors, and the Church to plant gospel seeds in young hearts
speakerNames: Matthew Stucker and Kelsey Gjesdal - English (with translation equipment)

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Next Step: Following the Call to Pastoral Ministry in CoG7
sessions.description: Artios Christian College and the License and Credentials Committee (L&CC) invite all interested students, current ministerial workers, and those considering a calling to pastoral work or ministerial advancement (from LPC to license or license to credentials). We will assist you and answer your questions about ministerial licensing and serving in the pastoral ministry in the Church of God (Seventh Day). Our goal is to support future pastors in their education but also in their calling, spiritual development, and readiness to serve. Together we will explore how God is preparing leaders for His church and how we can walk faithfully in that calling.
speakerNames: Steve Kyner, Brian Franks, Makayla Ross - English (with translation equipment)

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: How to Lead Someone to Christ
sessions.description: This workshop will encompass biblical strategies on how the church can lead non-believers, and believers who have gone astray to Christ.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: A Seat at the Table: Cultivating Christlike Hospitality
sessions.description: This workshop will explore the critical role that hospitality plays within the church, focusing on how we welcome both regular attenders and newcomers. We will compare the experience of being a guest at church to dining at different types of restaurants. Each type of dining experience represents various levels of service and hospitality, ranging from minimal to exceptional. This session will challenge participants to reflect on the current state of hospitality in their churches and encourage them to foster a culture of genuine love and care.

sessions.name: Evening Worship Service
sessions.description: We are a church on mission. Our passion: the call to service, fellowship, and worship. Our power: Jesus Christ, the foundation of the church and the authority that guarantees victory. Our purpose: to build God’s kingdom. Our promise: Success! The gates of hell shall not prevail against Christ’s church.
sessions.title: “Engaging our Generation for Christ”
sessions.aboutSermon: We are a church on mission. Our passion: the call to service, fellowship, and worship. Our power: Jesus Christ, the foundation of the church and the authority who guarantees victory. Our purpose: to build God’s kingdom. Our promise: success! The gates of hell shall not prevail against Christ’s church.

sessions.location: Convention Center - Room 355 A/B/C (Third Floor) or Hall C (First Floor)

sessions.name: Special Meal: Spring Vale Reunion Lunch
Workshop Session 1: Engage: So you’ve joined a worship band…
sessions.description: Music holds a significant place in modern worship services. Regardless of style, the power of music in worship lies in its ability to transcend words, touch the heart, and enhance our communal praise. Join us as we talk shop and explore some practical tips and tricks for enhancing your music for worship and becoming a better musician, team member, or team leader. A variety of topics are discussed, including band dynamics and working together as a worship team. We also discuss giving space to each other, serving the song, and how to identify and eliminate distractions to make it easier for congregations to stay focused.
speakerNames: Ruben Jr. and Jenny Davila - English/Spanish

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Getting Engaged with Ministry
sessions.description: In this half personal testimony, half practical workshop, join BA Editor Jason Overman as he shares his story of engaging with ministry and what he has learned along the way. In addition, you’ll learn more about the GC Publications Ministry and how you might plug into it.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: Getting Church Eldership Right
sessions.description: This workshop will provide a biblical framework for the role of elders in the local church. It will draw upon the New Testament vision of vibrant churches led by a plurality of spiritual leaders, called to and gifted for a lifelong commitment to shepherding Christ’s flock.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: A Seat at the Table: Cultivating Christlike Hospitality
sessions.description: This workshop will explore the critical role that hospitality plays within the church, focusing on how we welcome both regular attenders and newcomers. We will compare the experience of being a guest at church to dining at different types of restaurants. Each type of dining experience represents different levels of service and hospitality, ranging from minimal to exceptional. This session will challenge participants to reflect on the current state of hospitality in their churches and encourage them to foster a culture of genuine love and care.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 1: How to Lead Someone to Christ
sessions.description: This workshop will encompass biblical strategies on how the church can lead non-believers, and believers who have gone astray to Christ.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Homeschooling with Purpose: Tools, Tips, and Testimonies
sessions.description: Are you considering homeschooling or looking for ways to strengthen your homeschooling journey? I’ll share insights from my personal experience as a homeschooling parent — what’s worked, what hasn’t, and how we’ve seen God’s hand throughout the process. We’ll explore practical tools, helpful resources, and support systems that can make homeschooling both effective and sustainable for your family. Whether you’re just starting out or already on the path, come be encouraged, ask questions, and leave equipped with ideas and assets to help your family thrive in home education.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Restructuring GC Missions
sessions.description: Jody McCoy and Loren Stacy explain how the General Conference Missions Ministry is being restructured and the reasons that this restructuring was deemed necessary by the GC board of directors. If you have questions about which Missions Ministry efforts are continuing, which are being discontinued, and what to expect going forward, this seminar is for you.
speakerNames: Jody McCoy & Loren Stacy - English (with translation equipment)

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Self-Care: Care for Yourself to Care for Others
sessions.description: Self-care is “an active and continuous process of maintaining physical, emotional, relational, and spiritual well-being to sustain both personal and professional effectiveness.” Too often, we who serve others, whether in ministry, healthcare, or leadership, neglect our own well-being, leading to exhaustion, diminished joy, and even burnout. This session provides practical strategies to integrate self-care into daily life while remaining rooted in our calling.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Is Church Integration A Problem?
sessions.description: This workshop will go over the importance of church integration not to enhance one’s culture, or structure, but rather to provide a model where everyone will be edified. Problems such as cultural identity, segregation, and lack of church identity will be discussed, and effective solutions will be provided. We will also touch on ways to connect with our church and community today.

sessions.name: Workshop Session 2: Put Me In, Coach: Experience the Fulfillment of Your Role on God’s Team
sessions.description: The goal of this workshop is to help members catch the vision to fulfill their places in the work of God’s vibrant twenty-first century Church of God (Seventh Day). We will consider the following: who God is calling to His team; the effects of serving and not serving on God’s team; finding your gifts and place on God’s team; and a plan for equipping the players. Attendees should leave this workshop with a joyful and expectant heart regarding their roles in their local congregations, districts, and the General Conference.

sessions.name: Reception
sessions.description: Join us for a reception to honor the impact that our outgoing president, Loren Stacy, and executive director, Jody McCoy, have had on our denomination. Hors d’oeuvres will be served.

sessions.name: Evening Worship Service
sessions.title: Do Something: Engage Your Gift
sessions.aboutSermon: In 2 Timothy 1:6, the apostle Paul reminds young Timothy to not ignore the gift(s) that the Holy Spirit had apportioned to him. Every Christian is given a gift to demonstrate God’s love in an evil world. None of us has any excuse to sit on the sidelines.

sessions.name: Late-Night Options (Youth)
sessions.location: Convention Center - Room 355 A/B/C (Third Floor) or Hall C (First Floor)

sessions.name: Business Session
sessions.description: Call to Order • Morning Devotion • Report of the Registration Committee • Reading and Approval of Minutes • Report of the Resolutions Committee • Committee Reports • Adjourn Sine Die

sessions.name: Evening Worship Service
sessions.title: “Anointed: Engaged in the Service of the Lord”
speakerNames: Ronald Rousseau  (in Spanish with on-stage interpretation)
sessions.description: What is it to be engaged in the service of the Lord? It is a process of connecting with the Bible in order to have meaningful encounters with Jesus Christ by the anointing of the Holy Spirit.

sessions.name: Late-Night Options - Youth
sessions.location: Convention Center - Room 355 A/B/C (Third Floor) or Hall C (First Floor)

sessions.name: Children meet for Children’s Program
sessions.description: Parents, please bring your children to the designated area to line up with children’s staff for their performance. Please be on time. Children will be dismissed back to this area after their performance and must be picked up promptly.

sessions.name: Children’s Program and Worship Service
sessions.title: Engage the Word of God
sessions.description: The Bible is the Word of God. All of it. God’s Word is valuable for learning and teaching, for reproving and correcting, and for training us in the ways that are pleasing to God. When we engage God’s Word, we engage God himself. Do you want to hear from God? Engage His Word.

sessions.name: Evening Worship Service
sessions.title: Engaging the Kingdom of God Within
sessions.description: Despite the chaos of our age, within every believer abides the living and potent reality of the kingdom of God. This present reality is an intimate relationship with a loving God through the indwelling of the Holy Spirit — a relationship that forms the foundation and power for every Christian discipline and ministry. Begin to daily engage the kingdom of God within.

sessions.name: Pack Up Equipment
sessions.description: Your assistance is appreciated to help pack up equipment so we are out of the building before midnight.

speakers.name: Kurt Lang
speakers.about: Kurt Lang and his wife Kristen live in Harrisburg, Oregon. Their three adult children, Nicole, Jordan and Korban, are all in college and beyond, and reside in Oregon as well. Kurt currently serves as pastor of the Eugene, Oregon Church of God (Seventh Day), as well as English Asst. Dean of Academic Affairs for Artios Christian College. Past ministry roles include Youth Pastor (Harrisburg) and National Youth Ministry Director for the General Conference. His life motto is, 'He must become greater; I must become less” (John 3:30).
speakers.aboutSermon: Jesus, the Creator and King of the universe, wants to be the Lord of your heart. He invites us into a relationship, that we might be the recipients, yet also the conduits, of His Power and Presence. Are you grounded in Him?
speakers.title: “Sermon Title: Grounded In Jesus.”

speakers.name: Nigel Lewis
speakers.about: Nigel Lewis is the son of Sis. Phyllis Lewis and the late Pastor Stanford Lewis, one of seven sons in a family rooted in faith and service. He is privileged to serve as the local pastor at Brooklyn Community Church of God (Seventh Day) in New York. He also works in Information Technology as an Infrastructure Systems Engineer. Nigel is a devoted husband to his wife of 18 years, Stacy-Ann Lewis, and together they are blessed with two wonderful daughters, Emeylee who is 16 and Kylee who is 12. Nigel is a servant at heart and is deeply committed to being an effective minister of the gospel of Jesus Christ equipped by studies at Artios.
speakers.aboutSermon: We are a church on mission. Our passion: the call to service, fellowship, and worship. Our power: Jesus Christ, the foundation of the church and the authority that guarantees victory. Our purpose: to build God’s kingdom. Our promise: Success! The gates of hell shall not prevail against Christ’s church.
speakers.title: Sermon Title: The Passion, the Power, the Purpose, the Promise. Engaging our Generation for Christ.

speakers.name: Samuel Holland
speakers.about: Samuel Holland, a native of Jamaica, made a commitment to Christ at age 14. He is married to Lisa Howard Holland who is a high school teacher and track & field coach. Samuel pastored Access Community Church in Hamilton, Ontario for 30 years. He has served in various roles in our Northeast and Eastern Canada districts and also served on the Conference Board of Directors. He is employed as a vendor manager for a property casualty insurance company in Canada. Samuel continues to serve his local church on its board of directors and by leading its men’s ministry.
speakers.aboutSermon: In 2 Timothy 1:6, the Apostle Paul reminds young Timothy not to ignore the gift(s) the Holy Spirit had apportioned to him. Every Christian is given a gift in order to demonstrate God's love in an evil world. None of us has any excuse to sit on the sidelines.
speakers.title: Sermon Title: Do Something. Enagage Your Gift.

speakers.name: Ronald Rousseau
speakers.about: Minister Ronald Rousseau is a native of Haiti and has been a member of the Church of God for about 30 years. He and his wife Maria have served mostly in the Chicago area as a pastor. They have two children, Emanuel and Anastasia. His current ministries include serving as Senior Pastor at the Church of God (Seventh Day) Calumet City, as the director of SHINE ministries, and also as Superintendent of the Central District. His academic achievements include a BS Science in Electronics Engineering, an MS in Computer Science and Telecommunications, and he is a graduate of Life Springs Ministries. Ronald enjoys cooking (especially smoking meats), baking, photography, music, and hunting.
speakers.aboutSermon: What is it to be engaged in the service of the Lord? It is a process of connecting with the Bible to have meaningful encounters with Jesus Christ by the anointing of the Holy Spirit.
speakers.title: Sermon Title: Anointed. Engaged in the Service of the Lord.

speakers.name: Loren Stacy
speakers.about: Loren Stacy has served the General Conference of the Church of God (Seventh Day) since 1979 in a number of roles: Editor of Harvest Field Messenger Magazine (1979 – 1981), Youth Agency Director (1981 – 1985), West Coast District Superintendent (1986 – 1992), Board of Directors Member (1985 – 1991 and 1992 – 2015), Pastor of our Lodi, California congregation (December 1981 – June 2015), and Conference President (since July 2015). Loren and Karen Stacy have been married almost 47 years. They have been blessed with three happily married children and their spouses, and seven grandsons.
speakers.aboutSermon: The Bible is the Word of God. All of it. God’s Word is valuable for learning and teaching, for reproving and correcting, and for training us in the ways that are pleasing to God. When we engage God’s Word, we engage God, Himself. Do you want to hear from God? Engage His Word.
speakers.title: Sermon Title: Engage the Word of God.

speakers.name: Greg Lincoln
speakers.about: Greg and his wife Vaneice reside in Harrisburg, Oregon, where Greg pastored the Harrisburg Church of God (Seventh Day) for twelve years (June 2012 to July 2024). They are blessed with four children and five grandchildren. Greg has been active in ministry his entire life and has served in various roles within the General Conference. He has served as Pastor, Board of Directors member, General Conference Treasurer, Endowment Committee member, and NAMC Study Committee member. He is now our incoming President. Greg desires to continue our GC theme of “Focus on Jesus and Follow His Plan” and is trusting God for His strength, wisdom, and blessing.
speakers.aboutSermon: Despite the chaos of our age, within every believer abides the living and potent reality of the Kingdom of God. This present reality is an intimate relationship with a loving God through the indwelling of the Holy Spirit, a relationship that forms the foundation and power for every Christian discipline and ministry. Begin daily to engage the kingdom of God within.
speakers.title: Sermon Title: Engaging the Kingdom of God Within.

nominees.name: Andrew Burnett
nominees.churchActivities: Assistant pastor (2024 - present), elder (2012 - 2024), pulpit team member, chair of the Nominating Committee at Access Community Church (2018 - present), member of the Executive Leadership Team (2018 - present).
nominees.education: Honors Bachelor of Science in Human Biology and Zoology.
nominees.workLeadership: CEO of Lorama Group (2017 - present). Twenty-plus years’ experience in the specialty additives industry.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Served in numerous roles in the local church, including Sabbath school teacher, praise and worship leader, youth leader, and member of the outreach street ministry team. Functioned as a local church representative on the Eastern Canada District board for one term.

nominees.name: Narciso A. Betances
nominees.churchActivities: Has taught Sabbath school, preached, led baptism classes, performed baptisms and other services, led discipleship classes, and provided counseling sessions at the Lanham congregation.
nominees.education: High school, apprentice school for construction and masonry. Diploma of Pastoral Ministry from LifeSpring School of Ministry.
nominees.workLeadership: Worked in the masonry industry for over 25 years as a helper, apprentice, foreman, superintendent, and CEO of Elizabeth Masonry before accepting a full-time pastoral position at the Lanham congregation.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Served as a volunteer pastor for 18 years and as a full-time assistant pastor for 13 years at the Lanham congregation until his recent resignation in March 2025. Known for his passion for outreach ministry, Narciso has expressed a willingness to return to pastoral service. He is committed to supporting the congregation’s transition process and fostering unity within the Church of God (Seventh Day).

nominees.name: Samuel Holland
nominees.churchActivities: Board chairman. Men’s Ministry leader. District board parliamentarian. Church of God (Seventh Day) International Federation executive director.
nominees.workLeadership: Partner Relationship Manager for a casualty insurer. Served as district superintendent for Northeast and Eastern Canada districts. Conference board of directors as vice chairman and chairman.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Served as senior pastor for 29 years. Currently serves as chairman of local church board of directors.

nominees.name: David Lozano
nominees.churchActivities: Founder and Senior Pastor of Coachella Valley Church, Desert Hot Springs, California.
nominees.education: Honors Bachelor of Arts in Pastoral Leadership, Bachelor of Arts in Clinical Psychology and US History, Master of Science in Clinical Counseling with a LPCC.
nominees.workLeadership: Has served since 1997 as music director, Sabbath school teacher, preacher, deacon, executive secretary, co-pastor, and senior pastor.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Ordained minister since 2014 and credentialed minister since 2019. Instructor and committee member at Artios Christian College.

nominees.name: Oscar Mata
nominees.churchActivities: Lead pastor (2010 - present). Professor at Artios Christian College (2010 - 2021). Board member. License and Credentials Committee (2010 - 2018). Board member, Central District (2022 - present).
nominees.education: Juris Doctor. Bachelor’s in Legal and Social Sciences. Diploma of Business Administration. Theology studies. Certificate in Biblical Studies. Clinical Pastoral Education.
nominees.workLeadership: Experienced in pastoral, legal, and administrative leadership. Leads a bilingual, multicultural church. Fluent in Spanish, English, and Portuguese.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Church planter in South Dakota and Minnesota. Hospital chaplain. Active in online ministry and passionate about family, foster care, and adoption.

nominees.name: Dennis O’Banion
nominees.churchActivities: Trustee, board member, elder, and Outreach Committee director at Conroe Church.
nominees.workLeadership: Extensive construction experience. Currently a commercial superintendent at Davila General Contractors, Inc.
nominees.ministryHighlights: General Conference board member (chairman and vice chairman). Assisted in organizing local and national church events and conventions.

nominees.name: Richard Palmer
nominees.education: Certificate of Biblical Studies (LifeSpring), Associate of Christian Leadership (Artios, Class of 2026), Instrumentation technician (Mohawk College), Chartered insurance professional.
nominees.workLeadership: 18 years in insurance claims. 10 years of leadership experience.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Served on local church board as chairman. Leads ministries including men’s, worship, and youth.

nominees.name: Ramón Ruiz
nominees.churchActivities: Pastor of Monte Hermon congregation, Dallas-Ft. Worth, Texas.
nominees.workLeadership: Founder of San Nicolás congregation in Mexico. Former President of the Church in Mexico. President of the International Ministerial Congress (29 years).
nominees.ministryHighlights: 49 years of continuous ministry. Serves on National Evangelism Committee of the General Conference.

nominees.name: Jerad Ullrich
nominees.churchActivities: Elder, board member, youth leader, audio/video technician.
nominees.education: 3D Modeling, AutoCAD, Inventor, Solidworks, and other engineering software.
nominees.workLeadership: VP of operations in utility design. Senior sales manager. Small business owner. Chairman of Oklahoma Conference.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Served on Oklahoma Conference board for 26 years (15 as chairman).

nominees.name: Eduardo Villalba Jr.
nominees.churchActivities: Local board member at CoG7 Central El Paso. Former senior pastor at CoG7 Aurora, CO.
nominees.education: Bachelor of Science in Business Management.
nominees.workLeadership: Office manager at GC headquarters (2003 - 2021). US Army – 13 years.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Served in multiple pastoral and district roles. Instructor at Artios. Licensed in 2006, credentialed in 2012.

nominees.name: Ivan Villeda
nominees.churchActivities: Co-pastor at Monte Hermon Church in Arlington. Area 1 Representative, Southwest District.
nominees.education: South Gate High School graduate. Some college credits from Cerritos College, Woodbury University, and Artios. Finishing Certificate in Pastoral Ministry (July 2025).
nominees.workLeadership: Licensed real estate agent. 27 years at FedEx. Church planter. Various leadership roles in California and Texas.
nominees.ministryHighlights: Co-pastor, evangelism leader, youth pastor, and small group leader. Serving Monte Hermon Church (Spanish) and youth congregation.

nominees.name: Robert Grabinsky
nominees.churchActivities: Lay leader at Acme CoG7 for ten years. Board member and representative to Western Canada District since 2000. Weekly adult lesson and Bible study teacher. Coordinator of church activities and outreach. Church cemetery administrator.
nominees.education: Acme Christian Academy. Agricultural Production - Olds College.
nominees.workLeadership: In addition to the above church activities, raising grain and cattle on a multi-generational family farm.

nominees.name: Neftali Hernandez
nominees.churchActivities: Elder, preacher, Sabbath school teacher at Galena Park church.
nominees.education: Associate degree in Biblical Studies, bachelor’s in Biblical Counseling. Artios student seeking a ministerial license.
nominees.workLeadership: Member of local board in Denver Harbor church (1990’s). Member of local board and co-pastor at the Open Door church (2000’s). Member of local board at Galena Park church (2018 - 2021). Elder (2021 - present). Southwest District board member and Area 3 director (2019 - present).
nominees.ministryHighlights: Area 3 director: assists pastors in different areas of ministry; organizes district and area events, like Super Sabbaths, with assistance of pastors and leadership. Visits and preaches in churches. Provides workshops in Area 3 churches when asked. Provides counseling to some members in the area when asked. Participates in area pastors’ meetings. Assists members in funeral services and burials when asked.

attractions.name: FamilySearch Library
attractions.description: Explore your family history at the FamilySearch Library, offering free genealogy resources and assistance.
attractions.address: 35 N West Temple St, Salt Lake City, UT 84150
attractions.hours:
Monday: 9:00 a.m.–6:00 p.m.
Tuesday–Thursday: 9:00 a.m.–8:00 p.m.
Friday–Saturday: 9:00 a.m.–6:00 p.m.
Sunday: Closed

attractions.name: Great Salt Lake State Park
attractions.description: Visit the largest saltwater lake in the Western Hemisphere, known for its unique ecosystem and scenic views.
attractions.hours:
Visitor Center Hours:
Weekdays: 11:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Weekends: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM

attractions.name: Park City Main Street
attractions.description: A charming mountain town offering shopping, dining, and outdoor activities, including the Utah Olympic Park.

attractions.name: Antelope Island State Park
attractions.description: Home to free-ranging bison, pronghorn antelope, and other wildlife, with opportunities for hiking and photography.
attractions.specialNote:
Entrance fee: $15 per vehicle up to 8 people.
Senior entrance fee (65 years of age): $10 per vehicle up to 8 people

attractions.name: Thanksgiving Point
attractions.description: A multi-venue complex featuring gardens, museums, and family-friendly activities in Lehi, Utah.
attractions.address: Thanksgiving Point, 3003 Thanksgiving Wy, Lehi, UT 84043

attractions.name: Ashton Gardens
attractions.description: Fifty acres of themed gardens, including the Light of the World Garden with life-size sculptures.
attractions.address: Ashton Gardens at Thanksgiving Point, 3900 Garden Dr, Lehi, UT 84043

attractions.name: Butterfly Biosphere
attractions.description: Experience thousands of butterflies and other insects in a tropical conservatory setting.
attractions.address: Butterfly Biosphere, 3003 Thanksgiving Wy, Lehi, UT 84043

attractions.name: Curiosity Farms
attractions.description: Explore science and tech at Curiosity Farms, a working farm showcasing modern agriculture in Silicon Slopes.
attractions.address: Curiosity Farms, 2502 W Wildflower Ln, Lehi, UT 84043

attractions.name: Museum of Ancient Life
attractions.description: One of the world’s largest dinosaur museums, featuring numerous fossil specimens and exhibits.

attractions.address: Museum of Natural Curiosity at Thanksgiving Point, 3605 Garden Dr, Lehi, UT 84043

attractions.name: The Carousel
attractions.description: Enjoy a nostalgic ride on a beautifully crafted, hand-painted carousel.
attractions.address: The Carousel at Thanksgiving Point, 3653 Garden Dr, Lehi, UT 84043

attractions.name: Red Butte Garden and Arboretum

attractions.address: Red Butte Garden and Arboretum, 300 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
